text: Maria Alexandru (née Golopența; 30 December 1939 – 27 November 2024) was a Romanian table tennis player. From 1957 to 1980 she won several medals in singles, doubles, and team events in the Table Tennis European Championships. Between 1953 and 1979, she played in 12 World Championships, winning three gold medals in the doubles competition. She was born in Plugova, Romania. Alexandru died on 27 November 2024, at the age of 84. ==References== Category:1939 births Category:2024 deaths Category:Romanian sportspeople Category:Table tennis players
title: Maria Alexandru
